title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Central, Sabaragamuwa and Uva provinces and in Ampara and Batticaloa districts during the afternoon or night today (12).

title: Sri Lanka’s maternal mortality remarkably reduced, spike in low weight births: WHO
byline: The World Health Organization (WHO) highlights that Sri Lanka has made remarkable progress by reducing maternal mortality to 25 per 100,000 live births in 2023 due to the country’s free and equitable maternal health services and commitment to continuous quality improvement.

title: President AKD vows to not let racial or ethnic violence erupt in Sri Lanka again
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake assured that the National People’s Power (NPP) government will not let racial and ethnic violence erupt in the country again.

title: ‘Cost of living is the only thing govt has increased’ - Opposition Leader
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa claims that the cost of living is the only thing that has increased under the incumbent government.

title: 90-day detention order issued on Pilleyan
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has obtained a 90-day detention order on former State Minister Sivanesathurai Chandrakanthan alias ‘Pilleyan’ for further questioning, the police said.

title: Tesla launches in Saudi Arabia with its first showroom and service center in Riyadh
byline: Tesla officially launched in Saudi Arabia on Thursday, marking a new chapter in the company’s global expansion after Elon Musk ‘s troubled relationship with the kingdom — but the Middle East country’s extreme heat could pose a challenge for its electric vehicle performance and battery efficiency.

title: US ambassador to Ukraine to step down as peace talks uncertain
byline: The U.S. ambassador to Ukraine is stepping down from her post after nearly three years in Kyiv amid uncertainty over the Trump administration’s attempts to broker a peace deal to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: 43 individuals apprehended for engaging in illegal fishing
byline: Sri Lanka Navy has arrested 43 individuals involved in various illegal fishing activities during multiple operations conducted from March 25 to April 07, 2025, with the assistance of Fisheries Inspectors.

title: World’s oldest gorilla in a zoo celebrates her 68th birthday in Berlin
byline: Fatou, the oldest gorilla living in captivity worldwide, is getting ready for her 68th birthday in style.

title: Navy intercepts vessel with suspected narcotics haul off Sri Lanka
byline: Sri Lanka Navy has seized a stock of suspected narcotics in a craft during a special naval operation on the deep seas off the coast of Sri Lanka.

title: Hotlines to access information on public transport services during festive season
byline: Special passenger transport services are being operated today (April 12) as well to facilitate those returning to their hometowns for the Sinhala and Tamil New Year festivities.

title: MP Dilith Jayaweera challenges govt to disclose defence agreement with India
byline: Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance and Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera challenged the government to table the recently signed defense agreement with India in Parliament.

title: ‘Govt remains committed to ensuring peace and stability across country’ - PM Harini
byline: The Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the people of Sri Lanka should no longer be burdened by conflict and the government remains committed to ensuring peace and stability across the country, with the government and the public service must discharge their duties to meet the needs of the people.

title: Indian passenger arrested at BIA for sexual harassment on flight
byline: An Indian national has been arrested by airport police at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake for allegedly sexually harassing a female passenger during a flight from Dubai to Colombo.

title: Over 100kg of heroin and ‘Ice’ seized from fishing vessel, 6 arrested
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has confirmed the seizure of over 100 kilograms of heroin and crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as ICE) from a vessel intercepted during a special naval operation conducted in the deep seas off the country’s coast this morning (April 12).

title: Investigation launched into teacher accused of beating students with metal belt
byline: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) has initiated an investigation following reports circulating on social media about a teacher allegedly assaulting children at a boys’ school in the Colombo Education Zone.

title: Hundreds of flights cancelled in China as strong winds hit capital
byline: Hundreds of flights have been cancelled and train lines were suspended as gales hit Beijing and northern China on Saturday.

title: Trump exempts smartphones and computers from new tariffs
byline: US President Donald Trump’s administration has exempted smartphones and computers from reciprocal tariffs, including the 125% levies imposed on Chinese imports.

title: WhatsApp down: Major outage hits messaging services globally
byline: WhatsApp services have been affected by a disruption, leaving hundreds of users unable to connect, send messages across both the mobile application and the web-based platform.

title: CEB’s request to all rooftop solar system owners
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has appealed to all rooftop solar system owners across the country to voluntarily switch off their solar systems during daytime hours until 3.00 p.m. each day from April 13 to April 21.
